summary: This is an email exchange between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss efforts to obtain his current contact information, phone numbers, and the IMEI from a seized cell phone to facilitate further investigation through tolls, subscriber info, and heading info.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; his arrest is mentioned, and the correspondence seeks his current contact information and details about a seized cell phone.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email requesting additional contact information for Epstein following his arrest, seeking data to aid the investigation.

connections.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorney is investigating Epstein, seeking his contact information and details about a seized phone as part of the legal proceedings following his arrest.

events.title: Email Request for Epstein Contact Info
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails colleagues requesting current phone numbers, emails, and the IMEI from a cell phone seized from Jeffrey Epstein to obtain tolls, subscriber info, and heading info.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The arrest of Jeffrey Epstein is referenced as the context for the request for his current contact information and seized phone details.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested, prompting an investigation into his current contact information.
A cell phone was seized from Epstein, and investigators sought its IMEI and other identifying numbers.
The U.S. Attorney's Office aimed to obtain tolls, subscriber info, and heading info using Epstein's contact details.
The email exchange occurred on July 10, 2019, shortly after Epstein's arrest.
